_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Quincy Street, Inc. produces high-quality pork products that have helped to create lifelong family traditions. Our products include Dinner Ham, Breakfast Sausage, Ethnic Sausage, Deli Meats and Pork Loin. We use the latest smokehouse technology to create an old-fashioned natural hickory smoked flavor.



Food Safety is our number one concern. Our processes are audited by the Safe Quality Food Institute, the only North American organization recognized by the Global Food Safety Initiative. We are SQF Level 3 Certified, the SQF's highest rating. We are committed to creating a clean, safe work environment, not only for food safety but also for the safety of our employees. As our mission statement says: "Quincy Street, Inc. is committed to be a manufacturer and marketer of safe, consistent quality pork products. We will safely produce products to our customers' specification each time, and be recognized by our customers as the best supplier in our industry."



Quincy Street Inc. is a privately held, for profit, organization with the primary objective of producing high quality pork based food for nationally known companies. The majority of our products are sold in both the retail and institutional market places. Due to the refrigerated food products that are produced, Quincy Street Inc. utilizes a series of coolers, spiral freezers and storage freezers to maintain the integrity of its products and raw materials. The chemical that is used at the facility to perform the cooling and freezing of the environment and products is Anhydrous Ammonia. Because of its moderate toxicity and slight flammability, ammonia is considered a hazardous material.



Quincy Street Inc. is committed to maintaining safe manufacturing operations for our employees and the surrounding community. We follow all industry codes and standards, including the Michigan Occupational Safety and Health Administration (29 CFR 1910.119) and Environmental Protection Agency (40 CFR 68). Our priority is to prevent

accidental releases of hazardous materials instead of merely responding to problems.



Our RMP program includes elements addressing:



-Management System: An assignment of responsibilities of the Process Safety Management and Risk Management Program.



-Process Safety Information: A compilation of manuals, designs, information, etc. of refrigeration components that inform employees and contractors working with the system.



-Process Hazard Analysis: We conduct detailed studies of our refrigeration system to identify the important hazards and safeguards.



-Operating Procedures: We maintain written directions for the safe operation of our process.



-Management of Change: We review all modifications to the process to ensure they will not change the safety of our operation.



-Prestart-up Safety Review: Before the initial start of certain major changes, we follow a formal safety review to confirm the change has been install and designed properly.



-Employee Participation: We involve our employees at all appropriate points in our program.



-Training: We train our mechanics in safe operation and maintenance of the process.



-Contractors: We carefully screen contractors who work on our property to ensure that they have a safe work record.



-Mechanical Integrity: We have a comprehensive program of preventative maintenance and inspections to prevent mechanical failures. We perform a third party audit every five years. 



-Compliance Audits: We require, approximately every 3 years, our process safety program and look for improvements.



-Hot Work Permits: We control hot work that could start a fire around our process.



-Emergency Response: We coordinate with our Local Emergency Planning Committee and Fire Department for responses to emergencies.



-Incident Investigation: We investigate incidences to determine the cause and apply the appropriate corrective actions



-Trade Secrets: OSHA and EPA require us to maintain a trade secrets program in case con

fidential information affecting the safety of the ammonia refrigeration system is ever found.



We used the EPA's ammonia refrigeration guidance documents to estimate hazard levels. (See the Risk Management Plan, available from the Environmental Protection Agency, for details on the offsite impacts; due to National Security concerns, the U.S. Government has advised the regulated community not to disclose the actual numerical data in this Executive Summary.)



Quincy Street Inc. looks continuously for improved safety in our facility through the Risk Management Program.
